content:
Diagnosis:		Mucoepidermoid carcinoma of right main bronchus

Management:		Right upper lobectomy March 2024

Histology:		pT2aN0M0 mucoepidermoid carcinoma, MAML2 fusion positive

Current situation:	Post-operative surveillance

[redacted name] attended bronchial oncology follow-up clinic today. She has made an excellent recovery following surgery with no post-operative complications. Her exercise tolerance has returned to baseline and she reports no respiratory symptoms. Chest examination shows good air entry bilaterally with no added sounds. Recent chest x-ray on 15/5/24 shows expected post-operative changes with no concerning features. Blood tests are satisfactory. Given the complete resection and pathological stage, no adjuvant therapy is indicated. The plan is for continued surveillance with 3-monthly chest x-rays and 6-monthly CT scans for the first two years. Next clinic review will be in 3 months with chest x-ray.
